title: Black Friday bike frame deals | Save £2,000 on a Pinarello Dogma F10 Disc frameset
content:
The heart of your bike is its frame, and if you’re looking to put together your own build, or just fancy a project to learn some new skills, we’ve found some cheap road, gravel and mountain bike frames for you to choose from this Black Friday.

These frames cover a huge range of budgets and tastes – from £200 do-it-all hardtails to heavily discounted superbikes, and a mix of carbon, aluminium and steel frames to choose from, there’s something for everyone.

If you’re looking for other Black Friday cycling deals, check out our round-ups of the best Wahoo deals, the best Garmin smartwatch and GPS computer deals, the best bike light deals, and the best GoPro deals.

Where to find the best Black Friday cycling deals

Black Friday is here! Take a look below for a run-down of which retailers and brands have launched the best Black Friday sales.

Black Friday cycling deals: quick links

  • Amazon – The retail giant’s ‘Black Friday Week’ sale runs until 26 November
  • Wiggle – The Wiggle ‘Brighter Black Friday’ includes up to 50% off cycling shoes, wheels and tyres, and cycling clothing
  • ProBikeKit – Big Black Friday savings in the UK and US
  • Halfords – A wide range of Black Friday deals online, including discounts on nearly 100 cycling products
  • Tredz – ‘Black Ticket’ event with significant discounts on ‘nearly new’ ex-demo and ex-display bikes. Spend and save up to £300
  • Sigma Sports – Save up to 40% on a wide range of products, including clothing, helmets, smart trainers and cycling shoes
  • Competitive Cyclist – Save big over ‘Black Weekend’ if you’re in the US
  • Chain Reaction Cycles – New Black Friday deals released
  • Currys – the store’s Black Friday sale is underway
  • eBay – Reductions galore in the auction site’s Black Friday sale

Pinarello Dogma F10 Disc frameset – £4,600 £2,600 (save 44%)

Pinarello

Okay, so this doesn’t really qualify as a ‘cheap’ bike frame, but before you scroll angrily to the comments just take a look at the size of that discount!

Sadly, Pinarellos are rarely ever actually cheap, but with the money you save against the RRP on this frameset, you could probably get a groupset, components and wheels to complete the build.

If you ride a 57cm frameset, this really is one to check out.

  • Buy the Pinarello Dogma F10 Disc frameset with a 44 per cent discount from Swinnerton Cycles

Kinesis Aithen disc road frameset 2021 – £800 £599 (save 25%)

David Caudery / Immediate Media

When we reviewed the Kinesis Aithen Disc earlier this year, we praised its clean lines, stiff ride and its affordability.

This reduced frameset makes Kinesis’s aluminium race bike even more affordable, and if you’re looking for a go-fast budget build we highly recommend checking it out.

  • Buy the Kinesis Aithen disc road frameset with a 25% saving from Sigma Sports

Kinesis Tripster AT disc gravel frameset – £800 £675 (save 25%)

Robert Smith / Immediate Media

The Kinesis Tripster AT is billed as a gravel bike, but it started life as an ultra-endurance machine. It makes a perfect winter road bike with clearance for wide tyres, mounts for mudguards and practicality at its core. When we tested the frame a few years ago, we found it proved rock solid and had refined handling.

In keeping with the brand’s reputation, the frameset is also a great deal, made sweeter by the current 16% discount at Sigma Sports.

  • Buy the Kinesis Tripster AT disc gravel frameset with a 16% saving from Sigma Sports

Condor Leggero 2018 frameset – £3,499 £2,399 (save 31%)

Condor

This Condor Leggero 2018 super-light carbon frameset is identical to those ridden by the British bike builder’s former team, JLT Condor.

The geometry looks racy, but you won’t quite need a pro team budget to afford it now Condor has knocked more than £1,000 off.

  • Buy the Condor Leggero 2018 frameset with a 31% reduction from Condor Cycles

On-One Hello Dave – £799.99 £499.99 (save 37%)

On-One

The On-One Hello Dave is a wallet-friendly shredder, and it currently has 37 per cent off. Don’t let the hardtail design deceive you, this bike is designed for bombing through the woods and isn’t scared of taking on gravity rides.

The geometry is inspired by downhill bikes, and it has a radical 62-degree head tube angle and 77-degree seat tube angle. If you’re looking for a cheap, easy-to-maintain build with lots of potential, the Hello Dave is worth a look.

  • Buy the On-One Hello Dave with a 37% discount from Planet X

Eddy Merckx Laverdo68 road bike frameset – £1,599 £1,200 (save 25%)

Chain Reaction Cycles

Chain Reaction Cycles pitches the Eddy Merckx Laverdo68 as a perfect endurance-focused rim brake frameset. At just £1,200, it’s also relatively affordable for a high-spec frameset. Could this be the basis of a new adventure wagon for road-going adventures in 2021?

  • Buy the Eddy Merckx Laverdo68 with 25% saving

Pinnacle Ramin 2020 mountain bike frame – £250 £199 (save 20%)

Evans Cycles

If you’re looking for a simple frameset to build into a do-it-all trail hardtail, you could do worse than the Pinnacle Ramin.

You get a standard-sized set of component interfaces, such as a 73mm BSA threaded bottom bracket, post brake mounts and Boost dropouts, which should make picking up components to go on the frameset easy.

Better still, it’s available with £50 off right now at Evans.

  • Buy the Pinnacle Ramin with a 20% saving from Evans

Lugged Bicycle Frame Construction: third edition – £11.43

Amazon

If you’re just too much of a perfectionist and struggling to find the perfect frame to build up, why not make your own?
